section.name: MetaClass
section.p: MetaClass provides runtime access to attributes specified in javadoc format.
There are two steps involved: pre-runtime generation and runtime retrieval.

section.name: Generation
section.p: Generation is done with ant (refer run.xml). There exists an ant task called MetaGenerateTask that must be taskdef ed into your xml file, which is then run over .class files to produce .mad (metaclass data) files. It can be run in paired or non-paired mode.
In paired mode the .mad files are created in the same directory as the .class files. This is the default mode.

In non-paired mode all .mad files are created in the specified directory and named with dot-delimited full package structure. This is enabled by passing dest="${specified-directory}" to the metagenerate task.
